project.teaser: P2GreeN will foster a paradigm shift, from a linearly organised resource and nutrient system within the agri-food supply chain, towards a circular material flow system between urban and rural areas thereby restoring the coupling of the water-agri-food system using a holistic...
project.objective:
P2GreeN will foster a paradigm shift, from a linearly organised resource and nutrient system within the agri-food supply chain, towards a circular material flow system between urban and rural areas thereby restoring the coupling of the water-agri-food system using a holistic symbiotic resource management approach following the 3R principle “Reduce, Reuse, Recover”. P2GreeN will therefore develop new circular governance solutions for the transition from fork to farm to halt and eliminate N & P pollution by connecting blue urban with green rural infrastructure, focussing on circular nutrient flows of nitrogen (N) and phosphorus (P). This will be done trough implementation and demonstration of innovative N & P recovery solutions for the utilisation of human sanitary waste from urban settlements and its conversion into safe bio-based fertilisers for agricultural production in three pilot regions (P2GreeN pilot regions) on a north-south trajectory from the Baltic Sea region via the metropolitan area of Hamburg-Hannover to the region of Axarquia in Southern Spain. This approach will be extended to follower region in Italy, France, Greece and Hungary.
P2GreeN will close nutrient cycles of N & P to foster the transition towards a circular and clean economy (green transition) as well as supporting sustainable food systems from farm to fork offering viable alternatives to reduce the current usage of mineral fertilisers with innovative Green bio-based fertilisers and thus minimise the pressure on the natural resources, specifically water and soil. P2GreeN will further enable policy makers to replicate P2GreeN’s sustainable regional circular economy models in all regional settings across Europe. To facilitate systemic change, co-creation strategies including the participation of all relevant stakeholders as well as harmonised governance frameworks that foster innovations will be key to P2GreeN.
project.title: Closing the gap between fork and farm for circular nutrient flows
project.keywords: circular nutrient flows N and P, blue urban and green rural infrastructure, biobased fertilizers, symbiotic resource management, circular business models, blueprint governance framework

article.title: Converting human sanitary waste into bio-based fertilisers

result.title: Innovation platform established
result.description: The P2GreeN transition platform will be set up for the project and beyond. It will be designed and built to collect, host and serve the data, set of methods and tools that will emerge during the project’s lifetime. These inputs will be examined in order to define the data models to be used in the portal’s database, and the architectural structure (schema, dependencies, and access protocols). Moreover, due to the flexibility of the database’s schema, it will be possible to host methods and tools from 3rd parties to maintain the feeding of the platform. The P2GreeN transition platform will stay in function for 5 years after the project end.D7.2 is primarily related to T7.5, but also depends on the results of the other WPs like T2.1 etc.

result.title: Taxonomy of governance frameworks in Europe, learnings from the St-Vincent-de-Paul project and consolidated recommendations for the P2Green governance framework
result.description: The report will sum up the results about the benchmark of governance frameworks adopted in existing European projects related to circular N & P solutions, and a benchmark of a case study of decision-making on urine separation and collection in PARIS’ Saint-Vincent-de-Paul project. Based on this work, a taxonomy of governance models with recommendations will be developed and will then inform tasks 4.2 and 4.3. This report is linked to T4.1.

result.title: Report on results of actions for knowledge exchange and capacity building (4 focus groups) providing focus groups results
result.description: "Focus groups will be assembled in each follower region with the goal of supporting the development and adoption of P2GreeN's solutions in each region. These focus groups will emerge in the first year of the project, assist the feasibility study implementation in T5.2, and identify the pain points of applying the P2GreeN solutions. A series of workshops bringing together stakeholders identified in T5.1 will be held with the goal of increasing awareness and sharing knowledge of P2GreeN’s proposed solutions. Two physical workshops will be held in regular time intervals (M18, M36) in each follower region, where stakeholders of all kinds will be informed/trained on the specifications, advantages and disadvantages of P2GreeN’s proposed solutions with a continuous updating of the content moving from the first to the second workshop session. In addition, during the first workshop a twinning/mentoring process will be initiated, whereby stakeholders in follower regions will be ""twinned"" with relevant stakeholders in the pilot regions for the duration of the entire project with the aim of sharing knowledge, lessons learnt and best practice. The results of this workshop will be written down in this report (D5.5), which is related to T5.3."

result.title: Report of common guidelines for methodologies and templates for data collection
result.description: The report will summarize the common guidelines for methodologies and criteria for data collection in P2GreeN. These guidelines and criteria will be used by the pilot regions during the set-up and demonstration and for monitoring agroecological impacts in WP2. This report belongs to T2.1.

result.title: Host P2GreeN international conferences
result.description: During the project, 2 conferences (D6.5, D6.6) with P2GreeN stakeholders will be organised in a key location to showcase the project outputs, and to provide a focused forum for discussion on the results of the policy recommendations and the continuation of the collaboration activities. This conference (D6.5) is primarily linked to T6.3, but also touches other Tasks like T1.1, T2.1, T3.5, T4.1, T4.2 and T5.1 as it will shows the results of this Tasks.

result.title: initial data management plan
result.description: A data management plan (DMP) will be created and implemented by the co-coordinator IGZ to direct the collection, processing, handling, generation and storage of data within P2GreeN including scientific data collected in WP2 and all other data generated by the 3 pilot regions and the WPs. D7.3 is related to T7.5.

result.title: ‘Scoping review’ describing the status of the legislative framework
result.description: The report of D3.5.1 will be a scoping review about the understanding of broader legal and regulatory frameworks that govern from fork to farm and fork again. These frameworks are not simply local or national, but exist on a multilevel basis; the international and EU rules in particular are essential to address. It is linked to T3.5. In T3.5, challenges and opportunities in these multilevel legal and regulatory frameworks will be identified, reviewed and evaluated.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - P2GreeN (Closing the gap between fork and farm for circular nutrient flows)
result.teaser: P2GreeNs goal is to foster a paradigm shift from a linearly organized resource and nutrient system to a circular material flow system thereby reconnecting nutrients flows between urban wastewater infrastructure with the rural agri-food production.P2GreeN aims to:(1) provide...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Initial Plan for the dissemination ans exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Plan for communication, dissemination and exploitation: With the engagement of all partners, the first version of the D&E+C-Plan will be specified. It will include details of communication tools, dissemination approaches and channels of the partners at EU, national and regional level, and the overall strategy to ensure lasting impact. It will be yearly monitored, revised and updated (T6.2), and fine-tuned according to the results and the characterised needs of the partners, stakeholders and networks. The plan will be designed to maximise project visibility and disseminate results and outputs during and after the project’s lifetime. D6.1 and D6.2 are both related to T6.1.

result.title: Progress in set up of pilot regions
result.description: A first description of the set up of the pilot region and its working status will be summarized. D1.6 is linked to T1.1.

result.title: Network hub and repository of relevant stakeholders for engagement, outreach and impact
result.description: The network hub will be a list of relevant stakeholders and networks for cooperation and engagement to upscale impact and outreach of the project. This includes a range of sectors which will be invited to join this network, including farmers and citizens associations, industry, academia and research, innovation brokers and advisers, and policy makers. D5.1 is related to T5.1.

result.title: Project website & P2GreeN promotion package and visual identity established
result.description: The project identity will be developed and applied to the website, to social media channels, printed media, conferences, pilot regions and other items subjected to the use of the P2GreeN brand. The brand will be licensed under open source principles. Its execution is part of D6.3 and T6.2.

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
